info.title: Data API v1
info.description: One API to access account information from banks all over the world.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Meta data about the account connection

tags.name: Batch
tags.description: Lots of data in one call

get.description: Data about the access token and account connection.
Data about the end user. Almost all providers only populate the `full_name` field. We do not recommend relying on any of the other fields for your application.
Get all settled transactions for an account
Get all pending transactions for an account
Get standing orders for specified account
Get direct debits for specified account
Get all settled transactions for a card
Get all pending transactions for a card

post.description: Initiate collection of data for multiple cards and accounts in one call

get.description: Get data for multiple cards and accounts following a successful batch call

post.description:
Starts a process to extend a connection, by reconfirming consent and starting a new authentication if necessary.
You can find out more on how to use this endpoint [here](https://docs.truelayer.com/docs/connections).

scopes.info: read access for full_name of account holder
scopes.accounts: read access for current and savings account data
scopes.cards: read access for credit card account data
scopes.balance: read access for balance data. This must be combined with at least one of `cards` or `accounts`
scopes.transactions: read access for transaction data. This must be combined with at least one of `cards` or `accounts`
scopes.direct_debits: read access for direct debit data. This must be combined with `accounts`
scopes.standing_orders: read access for standing order data. This must be combined with `accounts`
scopes.offline_access: enables read access for 90 days after end user grants authorization

X-Client-Correlation-Id.name: X-Client-Correlation-Id
X-Client-Correlation-Id.description: Client-specified ID used to debug requests

X-PSU-IP.name: X-PSU-IP
X-PSU-IP.description: IP address of the end user requesting data. Necessary to overcome 4 calls per day rate limits

async.name: async
async.description: When set to true, data is fetched asynchronously. Expect 202 status code

webhook_uri.name: webhook_uri
webhook_uri.description: When async is set to true, a webhook will be POSTed to the URI provided

accountId.name: account_id
accountId.description: unique ID for an account or card

to.name: to
to.description: The date to retrieve transactions until in the format `YYYY-MM-DD`. The results include transactions from this date.

from.name: from
from.description: The date to retrieve transactions from in the format `YYYY-MM-DD`. The results include transactions from this date.

X-TL-Correlation-Id.description: Unique Id per request - we recommend logging this and always sharing it with our client-care team when opening incident tickets

X-Credentials-Id.description: Uniquely identifies a connection between the client and a users account(s)

X-Request-Id.description: Not recommended: `X-TL-Correlation-Id` should be used instead

Date.description: Date and time the message was sent

Last-Modified.description: The date and time a resource was last modified

ResponseStatus.description: Indicates whether the request was successful. 'Queued', 'Running' and 'Failed' can be returned for async requests

emails.description: ⚠️ This field is very rarely populated by providers

phones.description: ⚠️ This field is very rarely populated by providers

UpdateTimestamp.description: Last update time of the data

AccountType.description: Distinguish between personal and business, as well as savings and current accounts.

Currency.description: Currency used for this account or transaction

swift_bic.description: ISO 9362:2009 Business Identifier Codes. If swift_bic is not supported, one of the below values will be returned: `NOT_SUPPORTED_BY_GEO` or `NOT_SUPPORTED_BY_PROVIDER`

routing_number.description: Routing transit number. Only returned for US accounts

bsb.description: BSB (Bank State Branch) number of the account. Only returned for AU accounts

logo_uri.description: Use the providers endpoint for accurate provider data

display_name.description: Use the providers endpoint for accurate provider data

available.description: The amount of funds available to the account holder. This takes into account any pending transactions and includes any overdraft facility.

current.description: The amount of funds within the account. This does not include any pending transactions.

overdraft.description: Pre-arranged overdraft limit. Available for all “TRANSACTION” and “BUSINESS_TRANSACTION” account types.

TransactionCategory.description:
`ATM`: Deposit or withdrawal of funds using an ATM (Automated Teller Machine)
`BILL_PAYMENT`: Payment of a bill
`CASH`: Cash deposited over the branch counter or using a Cash & Deposit Machines
`CASHBACK`: An option retailers offer to withdraw cash while making a debit card purchase
`CHEQUE`: A document ordering the payment of money from a bank account to another person or organization
`CORRECTION`: Correction of a transaction error
`CREDIT`: Funds added to your account
`DIRECT_DEBIT`: An automatic withdrawal of funds initiated by a third party at regular intervals
`DIVIDEND`: A payment to your account from shares you hold
`FEE_CHARGE`: Fees or charges in relation to a transaction
`INTEREST`: Credit or debit associated with interest earned or incurred
`OTHER`: Miscellaneous credit or debit
`PURCHASE`: A payment made with your debit or credit card
`STANDING_ORDER`: A payment instructed by the account-holder to a third party at regular intervals
`TRANSFER`: Transfer of money between accounts
`DEBIT`: Funds taken out from your account, uncategorised by the bank
`UNKNOWN`: No classification of transaction category known

TransactionClassification.description: The classification and sub-classification of the transaction.

bank_transaction_id.description: This field is deprecated. Please use the top level provider_transaction_id.

provider_transaction_id.description: Starling only. This field is deprecated. Please use the top level provider_transaction_id.

transaction_id.description: TrueLayer's identifier of the transaction in a request. It may change between requests.

normalised_provider_transaction_id.description: TrueLayer's recommended identifier of the transaction in a request. It will not change between requests.

provider_transaction_id.description: Provider's identifier of the transaction in a request. The format of this string will vary across providers.

timestamp.description: Date the transaction was posted on the account.

description.description: Original description of the transaction as reported by the provider.

merchant_name.description: The merchant name identified in the transaction description.

frequency.description:
Frequency of the standing order. Possible values:
`EvryDay` - every day
`EvryWorkgDay` - every working day
`IntrvlDay:XX` - every XX calendar day
`IntrvlMnthDay:XX:YY` - every XXth month on the YYth day of the month
`IntrvlWkDay:XX:YY` - every XXth week, on the YYth day of the week
`QtrDay` - quarterly `WkInMnthDay:XX:YY` - every month, on the XXth week of the month and on the YYth day of the week.

timestamp.description: Date and time the request was made.

next_payment_date.description: The date on which the next payment for the standing order schedule will be made.

next_payment_amount.description: Amount of the next payment for the standing order

first_payment_date.description: The date on which the first payment for the standing order schedule will be or was made.

first_payment_amount.description: Amount of the first payment for the standing order.

final_payment_date.description: The date on which the next payment for a Standing Order schedule will be made.

final_payment_amount.description: Amount of the last payment for the standing order.

payee.description: Payee of the standing order set by the user.

reference.description: Reference of the standing order set by the user.

direct_debit_id.description: Unique identifier of the direct debit in a request. It may change between requests.

timestamp.description: Date and time the request was made

name.description: This is the name of merchant collecting funds via the direct debit. This is often a brand the end user would recognise eg. their utilities provider.

provider_mandate_identification.description: This is the direct debit reference. For AUDDIS (Automated Direct Debit Instruction Service), the merchant provides Core Reference. For non AUDDIS merchants provide Core reference if possible or last used reference

provider_account_id.description: An account id set by the provider. It is unique and immutable identifier used to identify the account resource. This identifier has no meaning to the user.

provider_direct_debit_id.description: This is a unique and immutable identifier used to identify the direct debit resource. This identifier has no meaning to the user and it is not always provided

pending.description: set to true to include pending transactions in response

balance.description: set to true to include balances in response

webhook_uri.description: a webhook will be POSTed to the URI if provided

account_ids_whitelist.description: if included, only accounts matching the provided IDs will be included in response

task_id.description: A unique ID associated with the task

client_id.description: Your application's client id, found in TrueLayer Console

new_user.description: Details of the end user who is connecting to their provider.

name.description: If the client is not regulated, they must provide this value.

email.description: If the client is not regulated, they must provide one of `email`/`phone`.

phone.description: If the client is not regulated, they must provide one of `email`/`phone`.

user_has_reconfirmed_consent.description:
Set to `true` if the user has re-confirmed consent in your application. We must review your consent screen and enable your client_id before you can set this field to `true` in production.

Set to `false` if you'd like the user to re-confirm consent in TrueLayer's auth dialog (setting to `false` is currently not supported).

client_secret.description: Your application's client secret, found in TrueLayer Console

refresh_token.description: refresh_token for the connection you want to extend

redirect_uri.description: A valid redirect_uri for your TrueLayer client_id (set in your Console)

state.description: An opaque value used by the client to maintain state between the request and callback

response_mode.description: If set to "form_post", when we call your redirect_uri, we'll include the `code` in a form POST request. If left unset, we'll make a GET request with the code set as a query parameter

access_token.description: A short-lived JWT token used to access data on behalf of the End user

expires_in.description: `access_token` validity in seconds. Default is 1 hour or specified by provider whichever is lower.

refresh_token.description: A long-lived code used to obtain a new `access_token` when expired.

token_type.description: Type of token returned. Must be `Bearer`

user_input_link.description: A link to direct the end user to confirm additional information. This could be a direct link to a bank authentication, or to TrueLayer if consent has not been re-confirmed.
A link to direct the end user to confirm additional information. This could be a direct link to a bank authentication, or to TrueLayer if consent has not been re-confirmed.

type.description: Link that describes http status codes

status.description: HTTP status code of the response

detail.description: More verbose explanation of the error.

instance.description: The endpoint from where the error occured.

trace_id.description: A unique GUID for the request.

value.error_description: SCA exemption has expired. This resource is protected and should be accessed shortly after PSU Authentication. In order to access this resource, please have the PSU re-authenticate.
Access to a specific resource has been denied.
Maximum number of requests per user allowed by provider exceeded.
The connector service is currently overloaded.
Feature not supported by the provider
The supplied parameters are not valid.

value.title: One or more validation errors occurred.
No way to extend this connection

request_timestamp.description: The ISO8601 encoded datetime specified in the original request

request_uri.description: The URI of the original request

results_uri.description: The URI where results can be fetched from when available.

credentials_id.description: Unique string identifying a set of End user’s credentials used to access a Provider

task_id.description: A unique ID associated with the task

200.description: Return 200 to indicate the data has been received
